content:
How to contact me:

‚Ä¢ Signal/WhatsApp: +447376786842
‚Ä¢ Email: ryan@rjgallagher.co.uk
‚Ä¢ SecureDrop: https://t.co/2nQo5d7jNj
‚Ä¢ PGP: https://t.co/cLvZdQ7YGb
‚Ä¢ Snail mail: 133 Fountainbridge, Floor 7, Edinburgh, EH3 9QG

All whistleblowers, sources, tips welcome. No PR pitches.

New: A few years before a major hack disrupted operations at US disinfectant producer Clorox -- resulting in $400m+ sales losses & costs -- an audit warned of systemic cybersecurity flaws within the company‚Äôs manufacturing plants https://t.co/w1aiL2aHgl
@micahflee That sucks Micah, you are one of the best in the biz, any news org would be lucky to have you on board. I'm sure you'll be snapped up in no time!

New: A second US Senator has attacked Microsoft's operations in China, adding to a wave of criticism from human rights groups following a @BW investigation on the company censoring its Bing search engine to satisfy Beijing: https://t.co/axl1kSLYWp

A Microsoft spokesperson reiterated an earlier statement that the Chinese version of Bing is ‚Äúthe least censored search engine‚Äù in the country & that leaving the market there ‚Äúwould only serve to cut people off from information they otherwise have through Bing.‚Äù
More here: https://t.co/k1HGYa78bF

US Senator @MarkWarner calls on Microsoft to consider pulling its search platform Bing out of China after our story revealing how it censors info on human rights & democracy. ‚ÄúUS companies should not be facilitating PRC censorship," Warner says: https://t.co/Iie9UovZt9
RT @BW: NEW COVER: Microsoft built a business where Facebook and Google couldn't, but in doing so has helped Beijing maintain its great fir‚Ä¶
RT @ngnaomi: Microsoft‚Äôs search engine #Bing is getting more popular in #China, but its success (& being the only Western search engine lef‚Ä¶

New: Inside Microsoft's Bing search engine in China, which is censoring information on human rights, democracy, climate change & much more to satisfy China's authoritarian government: https://t.co/jmHL80SwYX

Microsoft said its Chinese version of Bing is "the least censored search engine" in the country & that it'd rather have a presence there than not. "We only censor a result in response to a narrow legal order that we conclude obligates us to do so," said a company spokesman.
Read the full story: https://t.co/jmHL80SwYX
I discovered some within Microsoft are deeply concerned about the company's complicity in Chinese state censorship & have over a number of years raised internal complaints about its increasing scope.

US senator @RonWyden calls for overhaul of telecom security & sanctions to curb foreign govs & private surveillance companies that he says are hacking mobile phone networks to secretly track Americans in the US & journalists & dissidents abroad: https://t.co/eDQa4XdPKG

@natynettle The same CTO later praised the Russian censorship agency Roskomnadzor! Another comment of his that hasn't aged very well üò±
https://t.co/nZyfJCaEfN

US adds @Sandvine to blacklist that will effectively ban it from obtaining US technology; company enabled ‚Äúmass web-monitoring & censorship to block news as well as target political actors and human rights activists‚Äù: https://t.co/TraS1qcFtj

The company‚Äôs deep-packet inspection systems also appeared to have been utilized in Egypt to enable attempts to hack the iPhone of a presidential candidate, according to @citizenlab researchers. https://t.co/itTpR9k2K3

Sandvine was originally founded in Canada & was acquired by US-based private equity firm Francisco Partners in 2017. More about Francisco Partners & its role profiting from repressive surveillance & censorship: https://t.co/HSp3kcPYBg
RT @DonalGriffin1: EquiLend, a compay that sits at the heart of Wall Street's securities-lending industry, processing $2.4 trillion of trad‚Ä¶
@alextomo It is not uncommon for wiretapped call recordings to have two channels, one for each participant, because it is two separate lines that have been recorded & paired

US-Canadian tech company Sandvine developed controversial spy tool to help governments track encrypted Signal & WhatsApp messages. Recently quietly scrapped effort to sell to US agencies DEA & FBI after layoffs. Pitched product to govts across Europe, Middle East, Asia:‚Ä¶

Hack of Egyptian presidential candidate Ahmed Eltantawy's iPhone brings scrutiny to US-Canadian company Sandvine, whose "deep packet inspection" technology allegedly aided the delivery of spyware to his device earlier this year:  https://t.co/kTB32O5tKm

New research identifies NSO Group spyware campaign amid Azerbaijan-Armenia conflict; a dozen prominent figures in Armenia had iPhones hacked, including UN official, war crimes investigator, journalists, academics, a govt spokesperson. https://t.co/4sBSCRftHM

I spoke to the Big Take podcast about my story on the Israeli firm Rayzone & its product Echo, which is repurposing advertising data on a vast scale to help dozens of government agencies worldwide track people:

Four directors of German spyware firm FinFisher indicted over $5m deal to provide Turkey with tool used to hack government opponents; prosecutor says they tried to conceal sale via company in Bulgaria, violated export controls. Could face jail time. https://t.co/2riUX4VNLU

Twitter sued for allegedly helping to silence Saudi critics; suit claims Saudis targeted numerous dissidents by accessing Twitter‚Äôs confidential data via employees recruited as spies https://t.co/UgsNpPXDiG

I wrote about an Israeli company called Rayzone, which is using the advertising industry as a vehicle to collect vast amounts of data from mobile phones, then repurposing the data to help dozens of government agencies worldwide track people. https://t.co/2fpkLwCoTZ
@naughtfollowers Try this if you can't read it using the other link. https://t.co/HK3SX564q0

@ggreenwald @davidmirandario I'm so sorry Glenn, this is devastating news. David was such a great guy. Defiant. Courageous. Mischievous. Hilarious. Dug out this old photo I took of him wearing the Scotland football top I got him. Those were good times. Rest in power my friend ‚ù§Ô∏è https://t.co/mq4hjo9cSS

I went to Ireland to hear about a horrific cyberattack on the country's hospitals, which unleashed chaos & risked lives. Spoke to two dozen people involved & tracked down an ex-member of the criminal gang responsible.

‚ÄúWe were plunged into darkness.‚Äù

https://t.co/ea8CpNgq9M

He condemned the Irish attack & said he regrets working with Conti. But, being based in Russia, he claimed he could not get a legitimate IT job & is still working with other ransomware gangs. ‚ÄúI really want to leave. But this is my only source of income,‚Äù he said.
Full story: https://t.co/rzaSfDOkiq https://t.co/h5ShKlxZGg

The ex-member told me Conti had functioned like a regular business & was divided into multiple teams, each with about 10 or more people & its own team leader. He was paid a regular salary of about $2,000 to help find companies to hack & extort.

Ransomware gang Lockbit behind cyber incident affecting UK's @RoyalMail this week. Attack compromised dispatch systems that process international mail, has caused major disruption https://t.co/4aIOPkhZja

New: The work of two key teams that Twitter relied on to comply w/ data privacy protections in EU & US abruptly stopped amid a rash of layoffs, resignations & firings, which has put the social media giant at risk of investigations & hefty fines https://t.co/8XEzIzf87E

Individual employees at the company -- many of whom have now left -- were responsible for monitoring compliance w/ the standards, which, among other things, ensure that the company is correctly encrypting user data to keep it secure.

These developments follow expressions of concern by regulators in the EU & US that a staff exodus at Twitter may have undermined its ability to comply w/ rules intended to protect users‚Äô data.

Full story: https://t.co/8XEzIzf87E
The dearth of staff has meant the company doesn‚Äôt have enough personnel to oversee the maintenance of about 400 different information security standards, known as ISOs.
@JasonLeopold üëèüëèüëè
With intimidation & surveillance, China tries to quash the most widespread protests seen in the country in decades https://t.co/b8ClXL6AWS

Musk laid off half the team at Twitter that was devoted to tackling child sexual exploitation on the platform. The team was already stretched prior to the cuts.

Last week he tweeted that ‚Äúremoving child exploitation is priority #1‚Äù 

ü§î
 https://t.co/tYzRvOxwuc
RT @oliviasolon: Elon Musk has decimated the specialist global team dedicated to tackling child sexual exploitation, leaving behind an over‚Ä¶

Some of furniture giant Ikea's products were for years made using forced labor in Belarusian jails, report says. "Half of Ikea‚Äôs major Belarusian suppliers had links with penal colonies run by the authorities of Alexander Lukashenko" https://t.co/AtpolgZbWD

Asked a former Twitter employee about Elon's proposal here to make people verify their identities on Twitter via phone & payment system. Their response: "It's insane, he will get dissidents jailed & tortured if he implements this"
Such a policy would also likely deter some dissidents & activists in authoritarian countries from using this platform at all, which would be a gift to the world's worst dictators.

Twitter's human rights team would probably have highlighted these issues to Musk...had he not just fired them all
https://t.co/Dt9tcfwpDp https://t.co/QcwdN3YDu1
The current state of Twitter: "Multiple teams that were critical for keeping the service up and running are completely gone, or borrowing engineers from other groups" https://t.co/dJ9NCpC53A
‚ÄúI know of six critical systems (like ‚Äòserving tweets‚Äô levels of critical) which no longer have any engineers" üëÄ https://t.co/3dNqf4VR2Y

Belarusian hacktivist group @cpartisans says it's breached the Russian government censorship agency Roskomnadzor, encrypted some of its computers -- rendering them inoperable -- & stole 2 terabytes of emails & documents. Pretty incredible https://t.co/qSkqpM5fKC
If verified this would be the 2nd major breach of Roskomnadzor since Russia's invasion of Ukraine; Anonymous hackers targeted the agency in March & dumped 800gb of its internal files online.

Intelligence collected from downed Iranian drones used by Russia in Ukraine shows majority of the aircrafts‚Äô parts are manufactured by companies in the U.S., Europe & other allied nations https://t.co/WghEmgwkrN

RT @jeffstone500: The US's cyber review punted on investigating SolarWinds because of an urgent security risk, members told me.

But it's s‚Ä¶
@mhbergen Awesome Mark, congrats!
This is wild https://t.co/Ao6JjArFOw

New: Elon Musk's lawyer has sought to reassure Twitter employees they won't go to jail if the company is found in violation of a Federal Trade Commission decree that outlines steps Twitter must take to protect users‚Äô personal data. With @KurtWagner8  https://t.co/i81hImYEFd
‚ÄúThe people at Twitter doing the checks on that access are simply not there anymore,‚Äù one of the people said, adding that the privacy & security of user data has been put at risk as a result.

These latest developments come after a chaotic week at Twitter that has seen the resignations of several senior executives, including the Chief Information Security Officer, Chief Privacy Officer & Chief Compliance Officer.

Full story: https://t.co/i81hImGvr5

So many big resignations at Twitter in the last 72 hrs

- chief information security officer
- chief privacy officer
- chief compliance officer
- head of integrity & safety 
- director of software engineering

Hard to overstate the scale of the crisis the company is now facing
Apple limits AirDrop wireless file-sharing feature on iPhones in China after the mechanism was used by protesters to spread images to other iPhone owners https://t.co/uFuNpvmj13

Report says large investors in Elon Musk's Twitter deal -- like Saudi & Qatar -- have confidential agreements that spell out potential roles & how much access they get to internal company info  https://t.co/qbFely0RtR
US senator calls for security review of Saudi investment in Twitter: https://t.co/RQ0ehzQewO

Excellent work here from @JasonLeopold to obtain a previously top secret US document detailing how an NSA analyst snooped on Americans' private communications in an unauthorized surveillance operation:

RT @JasonLeopold: NEW #FOIA SCOOP/üßµTook me 6 yrs to pry this out of NSA

A few wks before @Snowden's leaks were published, 2 NSA employees‚Ä¶
Documents detail inner workings of the Russian war machine. Brilliant reporting https://t.co/nTsVWKleKc
There's not been enough scrutiny of the fact that Elon Musk's Twitter takeover has been propped up with cash from Qatar & Saudi Arabia https://t.co/lPhIp6Qw9j

Twitter was prev compromised by Saudi spies who used internal data to out dissidents & have them jailed. Surprising any new owner of Twitter - especially one professing to be a free-speech absolutist - would want Saudi influence anywhere near the platform https://t.co/FVyq2faJHm
Pleased to see our investigation with @TBIJ, which shined light on the murky activities of Swiss technology company Mitto, has made the shortlist at this year's British journalism awards

We found that a co-founder of the company, which was trusted by the likes of Google & Twitter to deliver sensitive passwords & security codes to users, also sold a secret surveillance service to help governments spy on phones: https://t.co/X6baoOXlQC
RT @ajmartinny: Stop whatever you are doing and sign up for our new newsletter, called the Cyber Bulletin, which will offer scoops, great y‚Ä¶

Nasser said security officials told him he would himself face jail and/or execution if he spoke out in support of his father while in Saudi Arabia. Now he's taking a stand against Saudi ruler Mohammed bin Salman from what he hopes is the safety of England.

‚ÄúIf any Saudi person would like to express their opinion they have two options: face imprisonment, which could lead to the death penalty," he says. "Or you live with your mouth shut and you cannot say a word that criticizes him [MBS] or the authorities.‚Äù https://t.co/c1LpElRe0Q

Hackers who breached a UK water company accessed a control system for ultraviolet treatment of drinking water at a facility that processes 32m gallons daily & serves 200k people. Unclear if they had the ability to contaminate supply; alarming either way https://t.co/CyLkrErF7p

Russia using combination of cyberattacks & physical intimidation in effort to seize parts of Ukraine's internet infrastructure, CEO of Ukrtelecom tells me. Says his employees sabotaged their own equipment to prevent Russia using it in occupied territories: https://t.co/FjHyUlnbAw
@chafkin Thanks Max

New: I spoke with some of the hackers & dissidents waging a covert war of sabotage against the authoritarian regimes of Belarus's Lukashenko & Russia's Putin. They are setting a new model for revolutionary groups. Here's their story: https://t.co/8KGiwnHOVR

...A group of dissident Belarusian cops then worked with the hackers to integrate the photos into a massive face recognition database, which they say they are now using to identify regime spies. It may be the largest counter-surveillance system ever created... https://t.co/xL6MV5H0QB

...I sent them a selection of random photos of Belarus citizens & they entered them into their database. Within minutes they had the correct name & bio for each person. It's a fascinating example of how technology is strengthening this resistance campaign: https://t.co/8KGiwnHOVR https://t.co/1bUYIgpJ38

Belarus hacktivist crew the @cpartisans says it's posted recordings of phone calls from the Russian embassy in Belarus. They told me they obtained these when they breached Belarus's interior ministry computers last year & found a secret government wiretapping system

The recordings themselves are pretty banal -- consular inquiries from Russian citizens about covid rules, passports, etc -- but nevertheless can't imagine Russia will be pleased to learn its closest ally has apparently been tapping its calls.

RT @netblocks: In areas of Ukraine under Russian occupation, internet access has often been disrupted.

Now, a new trend is emerging: As se‚Ä¶

New: US technology company Sandvine has quietly exited the Russian market after making major deals there in recent years to supply deep packet inspection equipment, a controversial technology that can be used to censor the internet: https://t.co/XBG64ZOB4D
Full story here: https://t.co/XBG64ZOB4D

Update: Rights group @AccessNow calls on Sandvine to withdraw all technology from Russia that could be used for censorship & surveillance, says US government should launch investigation into Sandvine‚Äôs business in Russia & other repressive countries https://t.co/ZxX5P28pYN
RT @Techmeme: Internet censorship tech provider Sandvine says it is pulling out of Russia; internal records show it had deals with two ISPs‚Ä¶

RT @natynettle: NEW: US-Canadian firm @Sandvine has been selling Deep Packet Inspection tech to Russia.

Same company notoriously facilitat‚Ä¶
The company's equipment has also been used to block an LGBTQ website in Jordan, independent news sites in Egypt, in addition to being deployed for a social media blackout in Azerbaijan.

Notorious hacking group Sandworm, linked to Russia's GRU spy agency, attempted cyberattack on Ukraine's electricity system, sought to take energy infrastructure offline last week in effort that was thwarted, security researchers & Ukrainian officials say: https://t.co/FQNZQ3Jqwc

Updated w/ new details. Ukraine official says Sandworm attack targeted regional energy distribution provider, known as an Oblenergo. Hackers placed malware on ICS Scada command & control system but were stopped before they could cause electricity outages. https://t.co/FQNZQ3Jqwc

German spyware firm FinFisher, notorious for its work helping authoritarian governments hack phones & computers, has shut down & filed for insolvency amid an investigation that was probing its alleged unlawful sales to Turkey: https://t.co/jCeYFIzJ7X

Two UK publishers censored books intended for western readers so they could be printed cheaply in China. Deleted references to Taiwan, Hong Kong & dissident artist Ai Weiwei. The 1st evidence that some books sold in west amended to satisfy Beijing: https://t.co/IhVtiqJezY

A group of Anonymous hacktivists say they accessed 100s of surveillance camera feeds in Russia & inserted anti-war messages onto some of them in an effort to "wake some of the civilians up, & urge them to fight back" https://t.co/l97UcJtMT6

The hackers didn't explain how they accessed the cameras. But most of the feeds I viewed were hosted by a Russia-based company, https://t.co/mLcFWTRgKj, which sells internet-connected cameras. The cameras were evidently not secured.

It's another interesting example of the information operations hacktivists are waging amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Several Russian news sites were breached in late Feb & defaced with similar anti-war messages: https://t.co/UtKC4sUX61

The cameras are inside offices, on streets, restaurants & elsewhere. Not clear where geographically each camera is located. I verified one of them is at a sports center in Tobolsk in west-central Russia where a basketball team called "Neftekhimik" plays its games. https://t.co/qHJREIJQYf

US company Cloudflare provides its services to several Russian propaganda & disinfo websites, including one said to be covertly operated by the GRU intelligence agency. Company defying Ukrainian pressure, says it'll continue to serve its Russian customers. https://t.co/ahh4ou4ojF
Up in the hills today, tonic for the soul https://t.co/Sj7vak2EIr

Bloomberg News will temporarily suspend the work of its journalists inside Russia after President Vladimir Putin signed legislation that criminalizes independent reporting in the country  https://t.co/HcJwdqYYNZ

If you have friends or family in Russia having problems accessing blocked websites they may be able to bypass the censorship by using the Tor browser: 
https://t.co/FRvvF581Xp (Russian) 

https://t.co/65DOiPoPTw (English)

Mirror: https://t.co/ovMaaiX5hK
@0xggus Thank you Gus

RT @0xggus: @rj_gallagher Hi! https://t.co/bK1fNNUFls mirror was blocked in Russia.
Try these options:
https://t.co/awFogAU77S
https://t.co‚Ä¶
@KimZetter I agree, but people in desparate situations don't always act rationally & think that explains some of what is going on here
@KimZetter I suspect that is the least of their worries right now when they have bombs falling on them, it's getting crazy but these are desparate people

Forbes walking back its report that Russian billionaire Alisher Usmanov's yacht was seized in Germany. Seems it's not been seized but requires some kind of customs permit to leave Hamburg & it's not clear whether that permit will be granted. https://t.co/Umq8mTO7eV

New: Ukraine cybersecurity official says 400,000 volunteers have signed up to aid country's makeshift hacker unit, says volunteers working to gather intelligence & attack Russian military systems: https://t.co/KLf8Ubnluu
Other hacking groups, including Anonymous and the Belarusian Cyber Partisans, are similarly focused on attacking various Russia-linked targets to support Ukraine‚Äôs resistance effort.

Zhora didn't endorse Anonymous's actions but said that he could "understand what they are doing." Says "we don't welcome illegal activity...but the world order changed on 24th of Feb...I don‚Äôt think appealing to moral principles works since our enemy doesn‚Äôt have any principles"
Assassination attempts on Zelensky thwarted by leaks from anti-war elements within Russia‚Äôs Federal Security Service, says Ukraine security official https://t.co/Hlp1vCtdrN

Some good research here from @CheckpointSW pointing to some supposed hacktivist groups that have made false claims about breaches (on Yandex & Russian nuclear institute) -- in fact what they're doing is just repacking publicly available info. https://t.co/trpXpn7Php

There are many groups right now making claims about different hacks. It's difficult to verify most of them. That doesn't mean it's all false, but it does mean it's worth being cautious about accepting as fact what some of these groups are saying until independently confirmed.
Good piece from @WilliamTurton on the "fog of cyberwar": https://t.co/JKuGZaPIY0

New: I spoke to the CEO of US tech co Epam -- which employs more than 30k people in Ukraine, Russia & Belarus -- about claims from workers he's been soft on Russia & the crisis he says his company is now facing: https://t.co/RpqGCQVfzY

Russian official says cyberattacks on country‚Äôs satellites a ‚Äúcause for war,‚Äù while denying control center taken down by hackers. Warning follows unverified claims from pro-Ukraine hacktivist group that it shut down space agency's satellite operations. https://t.co/lm5y53vTIn

France seizes giant yacht owned by @RosneftEN CEO Igor Sechin. Customs officials took control of the "Amore Vero" overnight in the Mediterranean port of La Ciotat, near Marseille, as it was preparing an urgent departure: https://t.co/K5IYEoQVj8
Meanwhile, German authorities are reported to have seized Russian billionaire Alisher Usmanov's $600 million yacht in Hamburg on Monday: https://t.co/iOna5ejhqd

Russian oligarchs are reportedly scrambling to move their yachts amid the ongoing sanctions crackdown. Several owned by Russian business leaders tracked moving toward the Maldives, which doesn't have an extradition treaty w/ US: https://t.co/ZnDPkdEsUg

New: Dissension inside US tech company Epam over company's stance on Ukraine. Contractor says he was blocked from accessing Epam computer systems after urging top execs to condemn Russia & provide resources to support a makeshift Ukrainian ‚Äúcyber army‚Äù: https://t.co/6uDig8lxYQ

Epam's HQ is the US, in Pennsylvania, but it has 14,000 employees in Ukraine, in addition 18,000 in Belarus & Russia.¬†Tensions have flared between Ukrainian & Russian colleagues. Some Ukrainian staff say bosses not doing enough to support efforts to counter Russia's invasion.

Maksym Chernikov, a senior software engineer for Epam, wrote an email to bosses calling for them to provide technical support to Ukraine's makeshift hacker army. 20 minutes later, his access to the company‚Äôs internal systems was cut off, he told me. https://t.co/6uDig8lxYQ
@dnvolz üò±

RT @bopinion: Hacktivists are defending Ukraine the best way they know how: Cyberattacks against Russia.

@parmy will be talking to @rj_gal‚Ä¶

A disturbing review of the Orwellian nightmare that is Russian state TV news, broadcasting an alternative reality in which Ukraine is bombing its own cities & there is no war taking place, just a "demilitarisation operation" https://t.co/nO1FBrwJJJ

Credit Suisse asks hedge funds & other investors to destroy documents relating to its richest clients‚Äô yachts & private jets, in attempt to stop info leaking about bank unit that made loans to oligarchs who were later sanctioned: https://t.co/1FnWHYWflw

I'll be having a chat on @TwitterSpaces later today about the surge in hacktivism amid the Ukraine conflict -- with colleague @Parmy & spokesperson for Belarus's Cyber Partisans @yuliana_shem. Should be an interesting one. Will begin at 4PM GMT (11am US ET)

Ukrainian man gets arrested for partially sinking ‚Ç¨7 million yacht owned by Russian weapons dealer on Spanish island. Tells judge: "I don't regret anything I've done & I'd do it again." He's now left the island to fight in Ukraine, local media report. https://t.co/dzsSuoAUOr
Microsoft president describes "offensive & destructive cyberattacks directed against Ukraine‚Äôs digital infrastructure" in hours prior to Russia's invasion: https://t.co/J8XGaGYJdQ
"This is arguably one of the biggest shifts ever seen in Germany's post-war foreign policy." https://t.co/O2Le4kC5Ct

Electric vehicle charging stations in Russia hacked, disabled, & made to display anti-Putin messages; Ukrainian company that provided parts for the chargers allegedly exploited backdoor in control systems. https://t.co/UyidID5uOr

Anonymous hackers claimed breach of Russian state media outlet TASS & other Russian news orgs earlier today. Websites were defaced with an anti-war message calling for Russian citizens to take to the streets in protest. Was pretty swiftly deleted; TASS is back online now https://t.co/QcMuPlElIB

New: Belarus hacktivist group  @cpartisans staged a new cyberattack on the country's train network today in effort to disrupt Russian troop movements into Ukraine. Group damaged railway control system, claims trains were halted in Minsk, Orsha & Osipovichi https://t.co/ExGc81v7He
The Ukrainian government has actively sought the assistance of vigilante hackers amid the conflict, as we reported on Friday. https://t.co/w5ieE4t2xU

The Cyber Partisans says it views Putin as a "common enemy" shared with Ukrainians. Belarus's govt is allied with Putin & has allowed Russia's military to use Belarus as a staging point for invasions into northern Ukraine. https://t.co/ExGc81v7He

The former train worker added that the traffic control system had been restored following the breach but said other systems weren‚Äôt operating & external train network websites were down. ‚ÄúIt is impossible to buy tickets,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúTrain movement is very difficult.‚Äù

Putin reportedly has a $97 million luxury yacht called "Graceful". A group of Anonymous hackers on Saturday figured out a way to mess with maritime traffic data & made it look like the yacht had crashed into Ukraine's Snake Island, then changed its destination to "hell": https://t.co/Ch53lcG7D6

A study last year in the Applied Sciences journal found that AIS was vulnerable to "unauthorized manipulations" & it noted the messages are not encrypted or authenticated, making it easy to tamper with them. https://t.co/c4bCZ0dify

The yacht linked to Putin was reportedly getting repaired in Hamburg, Germany, but moved to Kaliningrad, Russia in early Feb prior to the Ukraine invasion. It has an indoor pool, a spa, helideck, a dancefloor, gym & bar. Pics from inside it in this piece: https://t.co/ZzWHIhkRL7

New: I spoke to Ukrainians who say they have formed a makeshift "cyberwar" unit & are working with Ukraine's government to stage hacks on Russian officials & websites amid the ongoing invasion: https://t.co/w5ieE4t2xU
Reporting builds off this piece by @Bing_Chris & @joel_schectman in Reuters yesterday: https://t.co/tLh4TmswG4
Update from Ukraine's vice prime minister @FedorovMykhailo with instructions for people looking to help Ukraine's makeshift cyberwar unit: https://t.co/5qRr9eEa1h

New: I wrote about the terrifying rise of "zero click" hacks - a method of breaking into a smartphone or computer even if its user doesn‚Äôt open a malicious link or attachment. https://t.co/ATo8vGrCOx

@ZmiraOri @GrapheneOS I'd refer you to experts such as @billmarczak on that question. I suspect it may make it a bit harder to execute. But the general consensus seems to be that there is no silver bullet that can guarantee protection.

A lot more detail in the story:  https://t.co/6pHfR3UrbZ 

It's based on interviews with more than a dozen employees working in the surveillance technology industry, security researchers & hackers who specialize in zero click attacks.
Also I want to give a shout out to @mrcap123 for the really cool art he made for this story, thank you Chris!!

I spoke to several victims of zero-click hacks who told me how it affected them. Rania Dridi, a Tunisian journalist based in London, was allegedly hacked by the UAE govt. The breach of her iPhone left her feeling isolated & fearful for her safety. ‚ÄúThey ruined my life," she said.

New: Twitter cutting ties to European tech company Mitto after our investigation revealing Mitto co-founder operated a service that helped governments secretly spy on mobile phones. Twitter informed Senator @RonWyden of its decision last week. https://t.co/SxqWKCvS51

New: Russia-linked ransomware gang "Black Cat" allegedly behind the hacks that took down a swath of Germany‚Äôs fuel-distribution system this week & hindered payments at some filling stations, say people familiar with the breaches: https://t.co/ybsBCajwXl

Black Cat is the latest incarnation of the prolific DarkSide & BlackMatter ransomware groups, according to @BrettCallow. DarkSide was responsible for the attack on¬†Colonial Pipeline Co.¬†last year, which shut down the largest gasoline pipeline in the US for days.
@MargiMurphy @business Welcome Margi!

New: Google told US lawmaker it received a warning last May that European technology company Mitto was ‚Äúsiphoning‚Äù user passcodes to aid surveillance carried out by foreign governments: https://t.co/7FbsB5wFLz

Sen. Wyden said he was concerned about security vulnerabilities in phone networks, where there are ‚Äúshady middlemen selling access to surveillance companies and anyone else with a credit card.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt threatens the security and privacy of nearly anyone with a phone,‚Äù he said.
Full story: https://t.co/7FbsB5wFLz

Google has continued to work with Mitto despite these allegations, according to two people familiar with the matter. 

Other Mitto customers have cut ties. In recent weeks, messaging companies Kaleyra & MessageBird have both ceased commercial relationships with Mitto.

Belarusian hacktivist group the Cyber Partisans says it's trying to disrupt Russian troop movements into Belarus amid Ukraine tensions, breached the state-owned company that runs Belarus's train network & rendered its systems inaccessible w/ ransomware: https://t.co/OM53McUB0T
